channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The cultural works becoming public domain in 2026, from Betty Boop to Nancy Drew
item.description: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, s...

item.title: Christmas is over. Here's what to do with your holiday trash
item.description: Household waste increases by 25% between Thanksgiving and New Years. Rules vary by municipality on what you can recycle and what needs to go into the ...

item.title: Should the U.S. model its vaccine policy on Denmark's? Experts say we're nothing alike
item.description: The Trump administration wants to revamp U.S. childhood vaccination recommendations to align with some other peer nations, including one tiny country ...

item.title: Want a stronger body this year? Our newsletter can help you reach your goal
item.description: If your New Year's resolution is to start resistance training, Life Kit is here to help. Sign up for our Guide to Building Strength and get a month of...

item.title: Marijuana rescheduling would bring some immediate changes, but others will take time
item.description: President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijua...

item.title: US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria
item.description: President Donald Trump has previously accused the Nigerian government of failing to protect Christians from jihadist groups.

item.title: California rain may ease but more mudslides, flooding possible, forecasters say
item.description: A strong storm system that brought relentless winds, rain and snowfall to California this week was expected to ease Friday but there was still a risk ...

item.title: Stabbing, liquid toss attack in Japan rubber factory injures 15
item.description: Fourteen people were injured in a stabbing attack in a factory in central Japan in which an unspecified liquid was also sprayed, authorities said.

item.title: Should a top Russian archaeologist face trial for digging in occupied Crimea?
item.description: The case of a scholar wanted in Ukraine sparked a debate on the relationship between museums and the Russian state.

item.title: U.S. launches Christmas Day strikes on ISIS targets in Nigeria, Trump says
item.description: The strikes come after President Trump spent weeks accusing the West African country's government of failing to rein in the persecution of Christians.

item.title: Zelenskyy says he and Trump have agreed to meet "in the near future"

item.title: 4 found dead in Terrell on Christmas Eve, police investigating
item.description: Authorities have not released the victims' identities while they work to confirm identifications and notify next of kin.

item.title: Zelensky hails 'new ideas' on peace after talks with US envoys
item.description: Ukraine's leader gives an upbeat assessment after discussing the plan with Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner.

item.title: US judge blocks detention of British social media campaigner
item.description: Imran Ahmed was among five people accused of seeking to "coerce" US firms into censoring free speech.

item.title: New storm hitting waterlogged Southern California could bring mudslides and high surf
India's solar boom faces a hidden waste problem
item.description: A recent study has found that India will generate over 11 million tonnes of solar waste by 2047 if it does not scale up recycling.

item.title: Virtual reality opens doors for older people to build closer connections in real life
